name: vizier
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an important official in some Muslim countries in the past, especially one who advises and helps a powerful ruler: Shmu'el Hanagid was an 11th-century poet, general and vizier to the Muslim ruler of Granada. Kemal served in the government of Ahmed Tevfik Pasha, Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire.
often humorous the most important adviser and helper of a powerful person: At that time Campbell was grand vizier to the Prime Minister.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sultan sent an army of 7,000 men under Bekir Pasha, the Vizier of Bosnia.Lunch awaited in an upstairs chamber that could be mistaken for a grand vizier's reception hall. You could call me the grand vizier of British PR.Trevor Kavanagh was political editor of The Sun and grand vizier at Rebekah Wade's court.
